title.value: Multi-label Iterated Learning for Image Classification with Label Ambiguity
title.justification: The paper explicitly states its aim to tackle image classification with label ambiguity using a novel approach called Multi-label Iterated Learning (MILe).
title.quote: Inspired by language emergence literature, we propose multi-label iterated learning (MILe) to incorporate the inductive biases of multi-label learning from single labels using the framework of iterated learning.

extractions.description: This research paper proposes a novel technique called Multi-label Iterated Learning (MILe) to address the challenge of label ambiguity in image classification tasks. The paper explains how the MILe technique utilizes iterated learning to improve the representation of multi-labels from single-label supervision. It demonstrates the effectiveness of this approach on datasets such as ImageNet and WebVision, tackling issues of label noise and distribution shifts.

type.justification: The paper conducts experiments to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed MILe method on datasets like ImageNet and WebVision, thus making it an empirical study.
type.quote: Experiments show that our approach exhibits systematic benefits on ImageNet accuracy as well as ReaL F1 score, which indicates that MILe deals better with label ambiguity than the standard training procedure.

name.justification: The research primarily focuses on image classification, which is a key area within the field of Computer Vision.
name.quote: Transfer learning from large-scale pre-trained models has become essential for many computer vision tasks.

name.justification: The focus of the paper is on improving image classification with the proposed MILe technique.
name.quote: We propose MILe, a multi-label iterated learning algorithm for image classification that builds a rich multi-label representation of data from weak single labels.

name.justification: The paper involves techniques related to improving pre-trained models which aligns with Transfer Learning.
name.quote: Transfer learning from large-scale pre-trained models has become essential for many computer vision tasks.

name.justification: MILe is the novel model introduced in this research paper to handle label ambiguity in image classification.
name.quote: We propose MILe, a multi-label iterated learning algorithm for image classification that builds a rich multi-label representation of data from weak single labels.

is_contributed.justification: MILe is introduced and developed within the scope of this paper as a contribution to the field.
is_contributed.quote: We propose MILe, a multi-label iterated learning algorithm for image classification.

is_executed.justification: The paper describes the execution of MILe on datasets such as ImageNet and WebVision, indicating that the model was run as part of the experiments.
is_executed.quote: Experiments show that our approach exhibits systematic benefits on ImageNet accuracy as well as ReaL F1 score.

is_compared.justification: MILe's performance is compared against baseline methods including softmax and sigmoid based approaches as well as external benchmarks like ImageNet and ReaL datasets.
is_compared.quote: We report results in Table 1. MILe surpasses baseline methods on all metrics and all fractions of training data.

referenced_paper_title.value: Multi-label Iterated Learning for Image Classification with Label Ambiguity
referenced_paper_title.justification: MILe is a new contribution from this paper itself, so its reference is the paper itself.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We propose MILe, a multi-label iterated learning algorithm for image classification.

name.justification: The ImageNet dataset is prominently mentioned as a key benchmark dataset used in the experiments to validate the MILe methodology.
name.quote: We train our models on the standard ImageNet image classification benchmark [54], which is known to contain ambiguous labels.

referenced_paper_title.value: ImageNet: A Large-Scale Hierarchical Image Database
referenced_paper_title.justification: The citation [18] in the references corresponds to the paper introducing the ImageNet dataset.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Improved performance on ImageNet [18] has led to remarkable progress in tasks and domains that leverage ImageNet pretraining.

name.justification: WebVision is used in the experiments to test MILe's robustness to label noise and correlations.
name.quote: Experiments on WebVision [40] show that iterated learning increases robustness to label noise and spurious correlations.

referenced_paper_title.value: WebVision Database: Visual Learning and Understanding from Web Data
referenced_paper_title.justification: The WebVision dataset is referenced in context with citation [40].
referenced_paper_title.quote: Experiments on WebVision [40] show that iterated learning increases robustness to label noise and spurious correlations.

name.justification: IIRC is mentioned as part of continual learning experiments conducted to evaluate MILe's performance.
name.quote: MILe improves the performance of image classifiers for the singly-labeled and multi-label problems, domain generalization, semi-supervised learning, and continual learning on IIRC.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The citation [1] corresponds to the paper on IIRC dataset and methodology.

name.justification: ReaL is referenced as a multi-label evaluation set used to provide a more accurate assessment of models trained on ImageNet.
name.quote: To deal with unfavorable training dynamics due to the mismatch between the multiplicity of object classes and the majority-aggregated single labels, Yun et al. [68] proposed to relabel the ImageNet training set.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The ReaL dataset is referenced with respect to citation [9] which corresponds to Beyer et al.'s paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Beyer et al. [9] proposed ReaL, a curated version of the ImageNet validation set with multiple labels per image.
